examples: I don't know if she will be there, but it's worth a check .

definitions.definition: A control ; a limit or stop .
examples: The castle moat should hold the enemy in check .

definitions.definition: ( chess ) A situation in which the king is directly threatened by an opposing piece. [from 14th c.]
( US ) A mark (especially a checkmark : ✓ ) used as an indicator .
( US ) An order to a bank to pay money to a named person or entity.
examples: I was not carrying cash, so I wrote a check for the amount.

definitions.definition: ( US ) A bill , particularly in a restaurant .
examples: I summoned the waiter, paid the check , and hurried to leave.

definitions.definition: ( contact sports ) A maneuver performed by a player to take another player out of the play.
examples: The hockey player gave a good hard check to obtain the puck.

definitions.definition: A token used instead of cash in gaming machines, or in gambling generally.
A lengthwise separation through the growth rings in wood.
A mark , certificate , or token by which errors may be prevented, or a thing or person may be identified.
examples: a return check on a railroad

definitions.definition: ( falconry ) The forsaking by a hawk of its proper game to follow other birds. [from 15th c.]

secondary_definitions: A control ; a limit or stop .
( chess ) A situation in which the king is directly threatened by an opposing piece. [from 14th c.]
( US ) A mark (especially a checkmark : ✓ ) used as an indicator .
( US ) An order to a bank to pay money to a named person or entity.
( US ) A bill , particularly in a restaurant .
( contact sports ) A maneuver performed by a player to take another player out of the play.
A token used instead of cash in gaming machines, or in gambling generally.
A lengthwise separation through the growth rings in wood.
A mark , certificate , or token by which errors may be prevented, or a thing or person may be identified.
( falconry ) The forsaking by a hawk of its proper game to follow other birds. [from 15th c.]

definitions.definition: A pattern made up of a grid of squares of alternating colors; a checkered pattern.
examples: The tablecloth had red and white checks .

definitions.definition: Any fabric woven with such a pattern.

main_definition: ( textiles , usually pluralized ) A pattern made up of a grid of squares of alternating colors; a checkered pattern.
secondary_definitions: Any fabric woven with such a pattern.
